{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thyroglossal fistula is a congenital anomaly that occurs due to the persistence of the thyroglossal duct. This duct connects the thyroid gland to the tongue during embryonic development. It usually presents as a midline neck mass or swelling. The lining of the thyroglossal fistula is typically composed of squamous epithelium. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Lined by squamous epithelium.", "answer_choice": "A"}
